title.narrative: SUPPORT FOR REDUCING SCHOOL DROPOUT

description.narrative: Existence of multidisciplinary measures for reducing school dropout rates, including by preventing adolescent pregnancies and violence in school and engaging community-based support, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, boys and girls, especially the most disadvantaged, are in school and benefit from improved inclusive, gender-responsive educational policies and practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Existence of multidisciplinary measures for reducing school dropout rates, including by preventing adolescent pregnancies and violence in school and engaging community-based support

description.narrative: Strengthened capacities of the enrollment teams; continued support for promoting access to education for Roma adolescent girls; innovative education model for improving learning outcomes scaled up to 119000 students; a national programme on prevention of violence in schools was developed by an expert group in the MES; 46 600 school aged children from a total of 367 schools involved in World Largest Lesson Initiative promoting action to support SDGs; development of a child rights framework curriculum, teaching and learning materials and teachers' training program initiated. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/12/2019

baseline.value: Developed and ready to be pilot tested

actual.value: 2019:An integrated programme for prevention of child marriages is implemented in the region of Montana through the work of the Family Centers supported by UNICEF in Montana and Berkovitsa

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides data on attendance and dropout - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2019:TA provided to MES for the identification and documenting of good practices. Good practices are incorporated in the Guidelines for the enrolment teams.
